alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 09 at 5:55AM AKST until December 09 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: Temperatures have been running a bit cooler than was previously anticipated for the Juneau area, and snow has been falling through the evening and overnight across the Juneau area. Additionally, measurements through the evening and overnight hours at our office in the back of the valley show that higher snow ratios of between 10:1 to 20:1 have been occurring, which has led to higher snow accumulations. This highest accumulations are anticipated to occur near the back of Mendenhall Valley and at higher elevations. Snow ratios have been gradually decreasing through the night, and Snow ratios are expected to continue to lower through this afternoon, causing snow to accumulate less rapidly. Snow will tapper off Saturday evening. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 to 5 inches may occur, giving storm total snow accumulations of up to between 5 and 8 inches. This highest accumulations are anticipated to occur near the back of the Mendenhall Valley and at higher elevations. * WHERE...City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Heavy snow could be difficult to manage.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
